business_hypothesis: Rebilling and canceled flags create duplicated or missing recognized charges (totalcharge_and_excisetax / total_charges_n) and are a root cause of overstatement or understatement in reported invoice totals.
science_hypothesis: Records with rebilled = true (and canceled = false) are associated with a higher rate of duplicate charge-lines per order_id and a higher variance in totalcharge_and_excisetax_n; duplication rate difference between rebilled and non-rebilled groups expected >= 0.15 and mean absolute reconciliation discrepancy (per-order) Cohen's d >= 0.45.
null_case: Rebilled records do not increase duplication or reconciliation variance: duplication rate difference between rebilled and non-rebilled <= 0.02 and mean reconciliation discrepancy Cohen's d <= 0.10 with p > 0.10.

validation_methods.execution_plan: Group by order_id and compute unique combinations of (order_id, revenue_id, linehaul_chg_n, other_charge_n, totalcharge_and_excisetax_n) to identify duplicate line-items; compare duplicate_rate = duplicated_lines/total_lines between rebilled=true and rebilled=false groups using permutation tests. Pass criterion: rebilled group duplicate_rate exceeds non-rebilled by >= 0.15 with p <= 0.01.

Reconstruct invoice event sequences per order_id by sorting by entered timestamp (or id) and mark sequences that contain 'canceled' followed by 'rebilled' or multiple invoiced_flag=true events; compute per-order reconciliation_discrepancy = abs(sum(recorded_line_totals) - first_invoice_total). Pass criterion: proportion of orders with sequences containing cancel+rebill that have reconciliation_discrepancy > $0 (or >10% of order total) is significantly higher (p <= 0.01) than orders without such sequences.

Aggregate total_charges_n and totalcharge_and_excisetax per order_id separately for initial invoice and subsequent rebills, then run paired-difference tests (or Wilcoxon signed-rank if non-normal) to measure net change introduced by rebills; correct for canceled flags. Pass criterion: median or mean paired difference is non-zero with p <= 0.01 and effect size >= 0.45 indicating material rebill-induced change.
